intro: Meliosma corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered meliosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, which are often borne on the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
